result.execSummary:
The defendant Horace L Willis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care, cognitive intervention and domestic violence counseling. Not to associate with any member of any gang. No contact, directly or indirectly, with the victim. Deft is allowed to go to Family Court to facilitate visitation with children, but that visitation must not include any contact with the victim. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. Just be compliant with any child support or paternity order. Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Count 4 in 15CF1410 but concurrent with Count 1 in 15CF1410.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Horace L Willis

State indicates Chapter 950 compliance, no additions or corrections to revocation packet.
Defense indicates discrepancy with DOC sentencing recommendation.

State requests 18 months IC & 18 months ES.
Defense requests CFTS with probation on felonies, and concurrent jail time on misdemeanor counts, consecutive to felony counts.  

BTC:  on 15CF1410 count 1:  6 months RCJ
count 4:  3 years WPS (18 months IC and 18 months ES)
no alcohol or c/s unless prescribed by a physician, random UA's and breathalyzers
AODA assmt, treatment & aftercare, and any other counseling deemed appro by agent
no association with gang members
no contact with vicitim
cognative intervention, domestic violence assmt and counseling
employment up to which SSD will not be affected
comply with child support obligations
anger management program
CIP and SAT eligible
DNA sample unless one is already on file with DOC.

on 15CM2213:  6 months RCJ, concurrent to count 1 on 15CF1410 and consecutive to count 4.  

Firearms/voting warnings given.
Costs including DNA assmt.
CFTS against count 4 - may bring back to court if disagrees with accounting.
jail time can be served in prison system.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Horace L Willis in court with attorney Joshua Hargrove.  Defendant Horace L Willis in custody.  Randall Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 03:15 pm.
